channel.title: Ann Arbor Transportation Authority on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Ann Arbor Transportation Authority on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: AATA Route 5 service changes
item.description: From the news release - Sunday January 27, 2013 starts a new bus season, with improvements on the 5 route. All Route 5 details here for trips to Ann Arbor (PDF) and trips to Ypsilanti (PDF). – The service improvements are intended to provide: More reliable service (better on-time performance) Less crowded trips More direct and faster service for riders The number of buses on Route 5 will be increased from five to seven during morning and afternoon peak hours.

item.title: WalkScore now shows Ann Arbor Transportation Authority bus routes
item.description:
See the Walkscore apartment guide, and turn on the public transportation layer for Ann Arbor:
You can tweak the map to show how many minutes away you're willing to walk from a bus line to an apartment. This is all doable because the AATA now has open data for published bus schedules.

item.title: Lower Burns Park, Golden Avenue: plans from the City of Ann Arbor for two way traffic during State St closing
item.description:
Attached, please find the signing and pavement marking plan that we prepared to support the two week period when E. Stadium and S. State Street will both be closed to through traffic.
A more detailed copy of this is available at the Ann Arbor Government Document Repository, as document 300. You will note that the city's signage plan, at the date of publishing this article, is to run two way bus traffic on Golden for two weeks.

item.title: Conquer the cold! Preparing for the winter commute
item.description: Conquer the Cold is a program for submissions and suggestions on how to best make your winter commute a good one. It's run by get!Downtown, the Ann Arbor downtown commuter program, and there are fabulous prizes. Send in a 150 word essay and you could win a $500 shopping spree or one of many $5 gift certificates. To be eligible to participate in the Conquer the Cold essay contest, you must have a current go!

item.title: Proposed AATA Route 4 changes for January 2012 to get across campus faster
item.description: This route map, included in a recent AATA board packet, describes a new Route 4 routing which will speed up service to Ypsilanti by serving the U of Michigan Central Campus Transit Center instead of UM Mott Hospital on some routes. This is not a final map, and details of schedules were not in the packet.

item.title: Obituary: David E. Davis Jr., 80; dean of automotive journalists
item.description: David E. Davis, Jr. (b. November 7, 1930, Burnside, Kentucky; d. March 27, 2011, Ann Arbor, Michigan) was the founder of Automobile Magazine and a long time Car and Driver editor. His distinctive voice defined modern automotive journalism. He is survived by a wife, Jeannie, a daughter, and two sons, many friends, and a generation of automotive writers and car lovers. Services are pending. Memorials: Automobile Magazine: Davis was a lifelong car enthusiast who worked in all corners of the industry, from racing to advertising to editorial and publishing.

item.title: Anatomy of a bus stop: reflections from IUE 2009
item.description:
Some experiences shared from people who were at the IUE 2009 event.
Ed and Josh, waiting for the 3. Photo credit: Dan Cooney. All rights reserved (but I'm sure he'll share if you ask nicely). Three Minds on Digital Marketing (Organic) Edward Vielmetti, one of the more interesting presenters at this year's Internet User Experience conference, brought up a profound question that every business... and every consumer should ask themselves.

item.title: New AATA fare boxes require card swipes for all University of Michigan riders
